tooltip.title: Daily new cases
tooltip.body: Our daily new cases number is a seven-day average, and divided by every 100K people in a location. For instance, if a location has 200K people, we would divide the daily new cases by two.
tooltip.cta: [Learn more about how daily new cases is calculated](https://covidactnow.org/covid-risk-levels-metrics#daily-new-cases).

tooltip.body: This one is a bit complicated. To calculate infection growth, a mathematical model combines trends in daily new cases from the last ~14 day,  with estimates for other variables, such as how many days on average occur between infection and transmission.
tooltip.title: Infection rate
tooltip.cta: [Learn more about how infection rate is calculated.](https://covidactnow.org/covid-risk-levels-metrics#infection-rate)

tooltip.title: Positive test rate
tooltip.body: Test positivity is the number of positive PCR tests divided by the total number of PCR tests, over the last 7 days.
tooltip.cta: [Learn more about how positive test rate is calculated.](https://covidactnow.org/covid-risk-levels-metrics#positive-test-rate)

tooltip.body: ICU capacity used is the number of staffed  ICU beds that are occupied (by both COVID and Non-COVID patients), divided by the total number of staffed ICU beds.
tooltip.title: ICU capacity used
tooltip.cta: [Learn more about how ICU capacity used is calculated.](https://covidactnow.org/covid-risk-levels-metrics#icu-capacity-used)

tooltip.body: For “Shot 1” in a given location, we take the number of people who have  received their first shot and divide it by that location’s population, according to the U.S. Census Bureau.
tooltip.title: Percent vaccinated
tooltip.cta: [Learn more about how percent vaccinated is calculated.](https://covidactnow.org/covid-risk-levels-metrics#percent-vaccinated)
